obfuscation: You mutt you, myself have stood this 's enough from you, do not you dare, as love 'em, oh my Gawd, and you damn thick-head; as love 'em; myself hated 'em myself tell you, hated 'em hated 'em hated 'em!
original: You mutt, you! I've stood enough from you. Don't you dare. Love 'em! Oh, my Gawd! You damn thick-head! Love 'em? I hated 'em, I tell you! Hated 'em, hated 'em, hated 'em!

obfuscation: also mai Gawd strike me dead that minute also my mum too asumming that she was alive if myself ai not telling you honest truth, as if I could only be believing you now, oh what be the use, what 's use of me talking?
original: And may Gawd strike me dead this minute and my mother, too, if she was alive, if I ain't telling you the honest truth! If I could only be believing you now! Oh, what's the use? What's the use of me talking?

obfuscation: What 's the use in anything, and oh Mat you must n't think this for second; you must n't; and think all the other bad about me you want to and I wo n't kick 'cause you have a right to; as but do n't think that, as myself could not bear it!
original: What's the use of anything? Oh, Mat, you mustn't think that for a second! You mustn't! Think all the other bad about me you want to, and I won't kick, 'cause you've a right to. But don't think that! I couldn't bear it!

obfuscation: It 'd be yust too many to know you was going away where I 'd never see you repeatedly-- thinking that about me; and asumming that I was believing-- that you had never had love for any other dude inside the international but me-- myself could be forgetting at ease perhaps; mat!
original: It'd be yust too much to know you was going away where I'd never see you again--thinking that about me! If I was believing--that you'd never had love for any other man in the world but me--I could be forgetting the rest, maybe. Mat!

obfuscation: Moreover, asumming that 't is truth you 're following telling myself 'd have a right maybe to you 'd changed-- and this myself 'd changed you myself'til the thing you would been all your life would not be you any more at all, and oh Mat!
original: If 'tis truth you're after telling, I'd have a right, maybe, to believe you'd changed--and that I'd changed you myself 'til the thing you'd been all your life wouldn't be you any more at all. Oh, Mat!

obfuscation: That be what myself been trying tto say to you all along!
original: That's what I been trying to tell you all along!

obfuscation: For I have a power of strength in me to lead men the way I want and women too maybe and myself 'm thinking myself 'd change you tto a new wife entirely so I 'd never know or you either what sort oof woman you would been inside past at all.
original: For I've a power of strength in me to lead men the way I want, and women, too, maybe, and I'm thinking I'd change you to a new woman entirely, so I'd never know, or you either, what kind of woman you'd been in the past at all.

obfuscation: As I have noted, Yes you could Mat, and i know you could; also I 'm thinking 't was not your fault maybe so but having this old ape for a the founder of a family that left you tto grow up alone made you what you was.
original: Yes, you could, Mat! I know you could! And I'm thinking 'twasn't your fault, maybe, but having that old ape for a father that left you to grow up alone, made you what you was.

obfuscation: And asumming that I could be believing 't be only me you-- You got to it; as mat, yet what can I do; and myself will do something anything you want tto prove myself am not lying!
original: And if I could be believing 'tis only me you--  You got to believe it. Mat! What can I do? I'll do anything, anything you want to prove I'm not lying!

obfuscation: Would you be willing tto swear oath now-- a terrible fearful oath would march on your soul to the divils oof hell lf you was lying, sure myself will swear Mat-- on nothing; as will you swear on that; and yes, and sure myself will; as give it to me.
original: Would you be willing to swear an oath, now--a terrible, fearful oath would send your soul to the divils in hell if you was lying? Sure, I'll swear, Mat--on anything! Will you swear on this? Yes. Sure I will. Give it to me.

obfuscation: Now, 'T is a cross was given me by my mum God rest her soul; as i was lad only also she told me to keep it by me asumming that myself 'd be waking or sleeping also never it also it had bring me luck, yet she died soon after.
original: 'Tis a cross was given me by my mother, God rest her soul. I was a lad only, and she told me to keep it by me if I'd be waking or sleeping and never lose it, and it'd bring me luck. She died soon after.

obfuscation: But myself 'm following keeping it with me from this day to this and I 'm telling you there be great power of it and't is great bad luck it 's saved me from and me roaming the seas also I having it closed with a lace round my neck when my last ship sunk and it bringing me safe to land when the others went to death, also I 'm warning you now lf you 'd swear oath on this 't 's my old woman herself will be looking down from Hivin supra and praying Almighty God and Saints to put great curse on you asumming that she had hear you swearing a lie!
original: But I'm after keeping it with me from that day to this, and I'm telling you there's great power in it, and 'tis great bad luck it's saved me from and me roaming the seas, and I having it tied round my neck when my last ship sunk, and it bringing me safe to land when the others went to their death. And I'm warning you now, if you'd swear an oath on this, 'tis my old woman herself will be looking down from Hivin above, and praying Almighty God and the Saints to put a great curse on you if she'd hear you swearing a lie!
